intro: Scabiosa fischeri var. alpina, commonly known as alpine scabious, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, daisy-like flowers with white to pink petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Scabiosa fischeri var. alpina is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
